text:
Ash clings to every surface here. The ridge cuts across the sky like a scar that never healed. You walk it alone, buffeted by wind and dust. Far below, molten rivers surge through ruined valleys, carving songs into the stone.

A distant tower risesâ€”its spire broken, its flame long extinguished. Yet something within pulses. You remember standing atop it once, though the memory burns to grasp. Something was left behind there. Or someone.

A figure watches from across the ridge. They turn, cloak trailing, and vanish into the haze.
lore: This ridge marks the boundary between memory and forgetting. It was once called the Spinal Path, the last road walked by the Firebound. None who crossed it returned the same. Fewer returned at all.
